result.execSummary:
The defendant Universal K Allah was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Total length of sentence is 7 years; 3-1/2 years Initial Confinement; 3-1/2 years extended supervision.

superMiscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Absolute Sobriety
- No drugs without a valid prescription
- AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
- Random screens
- No Contact Order with Todd L.; and/or Frank A., AND/OR  his family; and/or the co-actor
- Court sets Restitution in the amount of $4,014.57
- Pay restitution in the amount of $4,014.57 - joint and several; restitution is due to Frank A.
- Seek/Maintain employment
- Job Vocational training
- Parenting counseling - both as to his children and the impact of this crime on other children
- No fine
- Pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the restitution surcharge.  Failure to pay during the term of extended supervision a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.  
Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for CIP, BUT IS eligible for WSAP. Restitution is joint and several.

records.addlTxt: ONLY THE FOLLOWING ITEMS ARE TO BE RETURNED: ITEMS 9, 10, 12, 13, AND 14.

Defendant Universal K Allah in court.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
NO COURT FILE. Court grants petition (No firearm or contraband will be returned). State to draft and file an order.
Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to DRUG ABUSE CORRECTIONAL CENTER ATTN: STEPHANIE P.O.BOX 36 WINNEBAGO WI 54985-0036.

It is ordered that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by DOC Central Records, and will be based upon actual release date.

It is further ordered that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.
Return of property hearing on September 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.
MPD Inventory #14004487/Items 1-16(JAMES SOKOLOWSKI).
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 7 Judge McAdams

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Universal K Allah in court with attorney Paul A. Ksicinski.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, Frank A., defense counsel and defendant. 
COURT ADVISES the defendant he must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge.  

As to Count 1:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  7 years with 5 days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  3  1/2 years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  3  1/2 years. 

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program but IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Absolute Sobriety
- No drugs without a valid prescription
- AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
- Random screens
- No Contact Order with Todd L.; and/or Frank A., AND/OR  his family; and/or the co-actor
- Court sets Restitution in the amount of $4,014.57
- Pay restitution in the amount of $4,014.57 - joint and several; restitution is due to Frank A.
- Seek/Maintain employment
- Job Vocational training
- Parenting counseling - both as to his children and the impact of this crime on other children
- No fine
- Pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the restitution surcharge.  Failure to pay during the term of extended supervision a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.  

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge - if not already done
-  DOC to collect those monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement received and filed.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Clerk:  jms
/from Justice Point, filed.
Restitution worksheet and victim impact statement received and filed.
Defense Brief in Support of Evidence Based Sentence for Robbery to Avoid Unnecessary Incarceration at Great Taxpayer Expense, filed.
/in support of defendant dated 6/04/14, filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Report
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledement received and filed. rn

Defendant Universal K Allah in court with attorney Paul A Ksicinski.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to negotiations, the State moved to dismiss and read in Count 2.  Court granted State's motion and ordered Count 2 dismissed but read in.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.
/in support of defendant, filed. rn

Defendant Universal K Allah in court with attorney Paul A Ksicinski.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date; parties requested a separate sentencing date.  Court granted same and ordered all terms and conditions to continue.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
/from Justice Point, received and filed.  Defendant compliant.
Violation report from Justice Point indicating new use, received and filed. rn

Defendant Universal K Allah in court with attorney Paul A. Ksicinski.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case was recalled.  Justice Point violation was reported to the Court.  Arguments heard.  State does not request additional bail at this time, just an admonition.  Court reiterated conditions of bail, admonished defendant and warned that further non-compliance would result in a change in bail.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue and continued matter before Branch 20 on 5/14/14 at 1:30 p.m.
/from Justice Point, filed. rn
State's proposed Protective Order presented to the court.  The Court signed and filed same.  Copy returned to the State for distribution.
State's Motion and Notice of Motion for a Protective Order Pursuant to Wisconsin Statute Section 971.23(6).

Voluminous discovery turned over by the State; parties request another scheduling date.  Court ordered case adjourned for scheduling before Branch 20.

Justice Point report received; defendant compliant.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.

Defendant Universal K Allah in court with attorney Paul A. Ksicinski.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

14RM006456  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
2/7/14 vf

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with FRANK A., AND THE MILWAUKEE SYMPHONY ORCHESTRA, CHARLOTTE., OR SALAH S.
DEFENDANT IS ALSO ORDERED TO BE KEPT SEPARATE FROM CO-DEF WHILE IN CUSTODY.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Court ordered case adjourned for ARRAIGNMENT in Branch 20.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Universal K Allah in court with attorney Paul A Ksicinski.  Defendant Universal K Allah in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Arraignment scheduled for March 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
